title: Group Anagrams
description:
Given an array of strings strs, group the anagrams together. You can return the answer in any order.

An anagram is a word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of a different word or phrase, using all the original letters exactly once.

Example:
  Input: strs = ["eat","tea","tan","ate","nat","bat"]
  Output: [["bat"],["nat","tan"],["ate","eat","tea"]]

Note: The output groups can be in any order, and anagrams within each group can be in any order.
test_code:
require_relative './solution'
require 'minitest/autorun'

class TestSolution < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    result = group_anagrams(["eat", "tea", "tan", "ate", "nat", "bat"])
    result = result.map { |g| g.sort }.sort
    assert_equal [["ate", "eat", "tea"], ["bat"], ["nat", "tan"]], result
  end

  def test_empty_string
    assert_equal [[""]], group_anagrams([""])
  end

  def test_single
    assert_equal [["a"]], group_anagrams(["a"])
  end
end
